title: Hanukkah
summary: Hanukkah[lower-alpha 1] (/ˈhɑːnəkə/; Hebrew: חֲנֻכָּה‎, Modern: Ḥanuka, Tiberian: Ḥanukā listen), also known as the Festival of Lights (Hebrew: חַג הַאוּרִים‎, Ḥag HaUrim), is a Jewish festival commemorating the recovery of Jerusalem and subsequent rededication of the Second Temple at the beginning of the Maccabean revolt against the Seleucid Empire in the 2nd century BCE.[3][4]
